container-title: and ‘Antirealism and the Epistemology of Understanding’
title: What Do I Know When I Know a Language?’
The phrase is of course Wittgenstein's from On Certainty, §141, and is appealed to by McDowell (1998a
This is the view advocated by Noam Chomsky. As he has put it: ‘language has no objective existence apart from its mental representation’ in the mind of the speaker
